events.originalText: President Bill Clinton awarded the Medal of Honor to 22 Asian Americans, mostly from the 442nd Regimental Combat Team, for actions during World War II.
events.subtitle: Bill Clinton
events.headline: President Bill Clinton awards Medal of Honor to 22 Asian Americans for WWII actions

events.originalText: The U.S. Supreme Court delivered its decision in the landmark case Miller v. California, establishing the Miller test for determining what is obscene material.
events.subtitle: Supreme Court of the United States
events.headline: U.S. Supreme Court establishes Miller test in Miller v. California case

events.originalText: Ellen Fairclough became the first woman to be appointed to the cabinet of Canada.
events.subtitle: Ellen Fairclough
events.headline: Ellen Fairclough first woman appointed to Canada cabinet

events.originalText: The Manchester Baby (replica pictured), the world's first stored-program computer, ran its first computer program.
events.subtitle: Manchester Baby
events.headline: World's first stored-program computer runs first program

events.originalText: World War II: The main offensive of the unsuccessful Italian invasion of France began.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Italian invasion of France main offensive of WWII begins

events.originalText: Irish War of Independence: Most of the village of Knockcroghery in County Roscommon was burned by British forces.
events.subtitle: Irish War of Independence
events.headline: British forces burn most of Knockcroghery village in Irish War of Independence

events.originalText: During a general strike in Winnipeg, Canada, members of the Royal North-West Mounted Police attacked a crowd of strikers, armed with clubs and revolvers.
events.subtitle: Winnipeg general strike
events.headline: Royal North-West Mounted Police attack Winnipeg strikers during general strike

events.originalText: Admiral Ludwig von Reuter scuttled the German High Seas Fleet in Scapa Flow to prevent the ships from being seized and divided amongst the Allied Powers.
events.subtitle: Ludwig von Reuter
events.headline: Admiral von Reuter scuttles German High Seas Fleet in Scapa Flow

events.originalText: In a bloodless event during the Spanish–American War, the United States captured Guam from Spain.
events.subtitle: Spanish–American War
events.headline: United States captures Guam from Spain during Spanish-American War

events.originalText: Rudyard Kipling's poem Mandalay was published.
events.subtitle: Rudyard Kipling
events.headline: Rudyard Kipling's poem Mandalay published

events.originalText: New Zealand Wars: A British victory against the Māori King Movement brought the Tauranga campaign to an end.
events.subtitle: New Zealand Wars
events.headline: British victory ends Tauranga campaign in New Zealand Wars

events.originalText: Crimean War: During the Battle of Bomarsund, Irish sailor Charles Davis Lucas (pictured) threw an artillery shell off his ship before it exploded, earning him the first Victoria Cross.
events.subtitle: Crimean War
events.headline: Irish sailor Charles Davis Lucas earns first Victoria Cross during Crimean War

events.originalText: In the Wallachian Revolution, Ion Heliade Rădulescu and Christian Tell proclaimed a new republican government in present-day Romania.
events.subtitle: Wallachian Revolution of 1848
events.headline: Ion Heliade Rădulescu and Christian Tell proclaim new government in Wallachian Revolution

events.originalText: Greek War of Independence: A combined Egyptian and Ottoman army began an invasion of the Mani Peninsula, but were initially held off by the Maniots at the fortifications of Vergas.
events.subtitle: Greek War of Independence
events.headline: Egyptian and Ottoman army invasion of Mani Peninsula held off by Maniots in Greek War of Independence

events.originalText: New Hampshire ratified the U.S. Constitution and was admitted as the ninth U.S. state.
events.subtitle: New Hampshire
events.headline: New Hampshire ratified as ninth U.S. state

events.originalText: French Wars of Religion: Catholic forces defeated an armed group of Huguenots attempting to capture Besançon, from which they had previously been expelled.
events.subtitle: French Wars of Religion
events.headline: Catholic forces defeat Huguenots in French Wars of Religion

events.originalText: War of the League of Cognac: The French army under Francis de Bourbon was destroyed in Lombardy, Italy, by the Spanish army.
events.subtitle: War of the League of Cognac
events.headline: French army destroyed by Spanish army in War of the League of Cognac

events.originalText: Second Punic War: The Carthaginians under Hannibal ambushed a Roman army in the Battle of Lake Trasimene, capturing or killing 25,000 men.
events.subtitle: Second Punic War
events.headline: Carthaginians ambush Roman army in Battle of Lake Trasimene during Second Punic War
